page.title: 03Leatherhead Training College
page.content: The Queen Elizabeth Training College is the biggest residential college for the disabled in Britain. It is owned by the Queen Elizabeths Foundation for the disabled, and is used to train the disabled to do a job most suited to them. Their patron is the Queen Mother. She visited the college in 1970 and again in 1984. Every disability except total blindness is accepted here and the disabled are trained individually. The courses available include Business Studies and typing.The college, situated in several acres of grounds, is beautifully kept by the gardening students. Their course lasts for a year because gardeners need to know how plants grow in each season. The college can take up to 330 students at any one time, and having been trained most students find jobs.
